title: 105_hr1646
content: The Act titled "Grandparent and Family Caregiver Support Act of 1997" exempts families headed by adult nonparental relative caregivers from work requirements. The Act exempts families headed by adult nonparental relative caregivers from work requirements and penalties for refusal to work. The Act exempts adult nonparental relative caregivers from work requirements and penalties for refusal to work under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include a penalty for states imposing work requirements on families headed by adult nonparental relative caregivers. If a state violates this, their grant will be reduced by 5% for the following fiscal year. Adult nonparental relative caregiver heads of families are exempt from time limits under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act exempts adult nonparental relative caregiver heads of families from time limit provisions related to work requirements. Amendments have been made to sections 402(a)(1)(A)(ii) and 408(a)(7) of the Act. The Social Security Act exempts adult nonparental relative caregiver heads of families from time limit provisions related to work requirements. Amendments have been made to section 408(a) of the Act to disregard months of assistance received by exempt adults. Amendments to the Social Security Act prohibit states from imposing time limits on assistance to families headed by adult nonparental relative caregivers. Penalties are in place for states that violate this prohibition. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996, as amended, prohibits states from imposing time limits on assistance to families headed by adult nonparental relative caregivers. Penalties are imposed on states that violate this provision. SEC. 4. Grants to states for assistance provided for adult nonparental relative caregivers. Section 403(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to provide grants for support to adult nonparental relative caregivers in eligible States. The grant amount is based on the State's expenditures in the previous fiscal year for assistance to exempt families or adults. "Appropriation of funds from the Treasury for grants under this paragraph as necessary for each fiscal year." SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. Section 419 of the Social Security Act is amended to define 'exempt adult' as an adult caring for a non-biological minor child and 'exempt family' as a family meeting specific criteria. The term 'exempt family' refers to a family headed by an adult caring for a non-biological minor child, excluding the parent of the child and any biological children of the adult. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if included in the enactment of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996.
